benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/refresh - Refresh account payment methods

covered: Valid Request coverage: multiple scenarios exercise successful refresh with required params and various pluginName/pluginProperty combinations (TC01–TC07, TC06).
Non-Existing Resource coverage: tests for non-existent account and empty database (TC09, TC27).
Authorization coverage: missing or invalid authentication header scenarios (TC10, TC15).
Input Validation coverage: invalid accountId format, unsupported pluginName, malformed pluginProperty, and security-related inputs (TC08, TC11, TC12, TC16, TC17).
Edge cases coverage: handling extra unexpected query parameters, very large accountId values, and timeout behavior (TC18, TC19, TC20).
Payload/Property Size and Validation: tests for large pluginProperty values and size boundaries (TC07, TC24).
Performance/Degradation coverage: concurrent requests, degraded performance scenarios, and timeouts (TC23, TC14, TC29, TC20).
Integration and Data Consistency coverage: gateway/plugin service unavailability and data consistency checks (TC13, TC25, TC26).
Regression coverage: pluginProperty encoding and backward compatibility with older clients (TC21, TC22).
Accessibility coverage: API documentation and error-message accessibility considerations (TC30).
gaps: Pagination handling for large data sets is not tested.
Rate limiting/throttling scenarios are not covered.
Partial update semantics for PUT are not explicitly exercised (beyond full refresh flows).
Concurrency/race-condition testing for simultaneous refreshes is missing.
Explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenarios (e.g., DB/internal failures) are not explicitly tested beyond gateway errors.
Expanded authorization scenarios (e.g., expired tokens, scope-based access) are not covered.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests to verify behavior when listing or processing large sets of accounts or results, if applicable.
Introduce rate-limiting/throttling tests (429 responses) and validate behavior under bursty traffic.
Add tests to validate caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) and potential 304 responses where relevant.
Add a dedicated PUT partial-update validation to confirm partial updates are rejected or handled as designed, if applicable.
Add concurrency/race-condition tests for simultaneous refresh requests on the same account to detect race conditions.
Include explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenarios to cover unexpected server-side failures (e.g., DB outages).
Expand authorization tests to cover additional token scenarios (expired/revoked tokens, scopes).
